poem:
Title: "Inauguration, in Emerald Tones"

Celtic crowns a cradle king, at thirty-seven named,
In Dáil's echoey chambers, the old mouths all declaimed.
To Harris, TikTok Taoiseach, a seal of a different breed,
88 in favour, their voices planting seed.
An isle's youth in command, the digital and the green,
A fresh hope in Eire's hand, a tale yet to be seen.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Dáil confirms Simon Harris as Ireland’s new taoiseach – as it happened 2.41pm BST Summary of the day The Dáil has confirmed Simon Harris’ nomination as Ireland’s new taoiseach, by a vote of 88 in favour and 69 opposed. Ireland’s president, Michael D Higgins, then presented Harris with his seal of office. At 37, Harris is Ireland’s youngest prime minister. His social media skills have prompted a nickname, the “TikTok taoiseach”. In today’s vote, Harris". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Dáil confirms Simon Harris as Ireland’s new taoiseach – as it happened 2.41pm BST Summary of the day The Dáil has confirmed Simon Harris’ nomination as Ireland’s new taoiseach, by a vote of 88 in favour and 69 opposed. Ireland’s president, Michael D Higgins, then presented Harris with his seal of office. At 37, Harris is Ireland’s youngest prime minister. His social media skills have prompted a nickname, the “TikTok taoiseach”. In today’s vote, Harris
